Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful service and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: megan a Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Got there- have to carry suitcases up steep staircase, leave deposit for key. Got to room- lights didn't work. Went downstairs, receptionist girl said they'd send someone up to fix it while we were out. One bed cover was ripped, and none of the pillows had pillowcases, and were stained. No towels. Back downstairs, asked for those, she said they keep them there, you have to ask. Went out. Came back at around 11pm- NO LIGHTS!!!! We were really tired, and couldn't find our stuff to pack and ask for a new room, so just laid down and went to sleep. Complained in the morning, no help, left that day. Breakfast- not bad. They had lunchmeat, cheese, breads, a nifty toaster thing for them, nutella, jam, and a breakfast cake thing. Lots of juices and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “It was clean”
Reviews.Author: Paul p Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The issue with the room was I booked 2 sinlge beds paid for 2 yet paid for 2 singles beds yet you thought it would b ok to put us up in double bed and set this out as 2 singles So I feel let down. If u had of told me about this and the price was looked at then ok. I feel that I have been misled. I would not use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: MCMSmith
Reviews.Content: Disaster of a 'hotel', I have stayed in hostels that were much better than this place. Same experience as most of the other reviews. I was in a room downstairs the bathroom was terrible, no hot water in the sink (in reality it was a small hand washing sink with a cold water tap) and you had to hold the shower head as there wasnt a wall bracket. The wardrobe fell over when i tried opening it and it didnt have a back in it either! The sheets hadnt been washed, the window wouldn't close. Breakfast was awful and I went to a bakery down the street instead. At least I have a clear winner in the 'worst hotel stay ever'!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Adam J
Reviews.Content: We booked 2nd time at y boulevard stay was ok for 2 nights in amsterdam the breakfast was good.the stuff was good. Room also good but need extra claen

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as expected!”
Reviews.Author: C N Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: after reding the reviews on here prior to our visit, i feared the worst and expected to come home covered in bed bug bites but on arrival to the hotel there was no sign of them! we heard mice running along the ceiling but as young people who were there for fun it was pretty damn good! this hotel isn't great for those in search of a relaxing holiday but perfect for young groups who are there for nightlife and everything else amsterdam has to offer

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey87_12
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here which was more than enough! Arrivng at the hotel, me and my partner were greeted with a friendly receptionist. Leaving our bags we went to explore Amsterdam, returning later to check in. The location was further away from the centre then we first thought or would have liked. When we arrived back at the hotel, we were given the key to our room. The room (#25) was quite poor. There was a strong smell of them insense sticks which I dislike, I found stains on the bedding! The shower didn't work and leaked all water out of the pipe! And the stench from the bathroom was disgusting! Can't complain at the noise level as it is fairly noisy outside late into the night but this does not bother us! Exhausted, we slept but woke early in time for breakfast. Which was very much a dissapointment too! Dry ham & cheese was offered with bread, you can toast yourself, along with jam, peanust butter and Nutella.There was also 2 cakes available, neither of which we tasted. The Fresh Orange/Apple Juice & Coffee was the most appealing thing we had for breakfast there. We cheked out but left our bags there whilst we spent our last day exploring Amsterdam. When we returned for the bag there was another receptionist, and a rude lady she was. We left straight after asking for some cartons of milk for the coffee machine (2euro per cup) and being told there was none when there clearly was!! If she got off her backside and checked she would have seen there was some! All I can say is, we tried it and now know where not to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT book with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: E K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a hostel. We were shown to our room on the top floor which was freezing cold, i had booked a double room but instead we were put in a twin room. Both beds had dirty pillowcases and stained blankets. The walls were smeared with dirt and other questionable stains.. The room was so cold that two of us shared a single bed and slept in our jeans and jumpers and noise from the road outside woke us both a number of times despite us both normally being heavy sleepers. I never usually review rooms but i have never stayed anywhere this dirty or disgusting before, in the end we checked out early and spend extra money on a new room in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dirty-not two stars, maybe 1/2”
Reviews.Author: Eden K
Reviews.Content: I should have guessed what I would get for the price, but I paid for the room before looking at it, then saw that the bedsheets were dirty and the mattress really dirty, so I said I wanted to leave and could I have a refund, and they said no. I didn't care- I left anyway. The whole placed was dirty and smelled like smoke. Only stay here if you absolutely have to.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katarzyna K
Reviews.Content: That was the worst place I've ever stayed during my Europe trips. Smelly bathroom, dirty stairs and carpets and the worst thing - bed bugs! Do not stay in this place!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. My traveling partner booked the reservations and only after did we find out the terrible reviews. It was as bad as it sounds. We had booked a double room but when we checked in, were informed that it was unavailable and they moved us to a quad with single beds in the attic. In the night, we heard rodents scurrying around, evidenced by the fact that they gnawed through a cardboard box to get to a chocolate bar I had in my luggage. We were able to move rooms the next day, but this was probably worse. The third day, after drying off with a tiny face towel b/c there were no decent sized bath towels, I noticed something crawling on our bed. It was a bed bug! I found another one, killed them both and saved them in a plastic bag to present to the reception. Upon further inspection of the bed, I noticed several small bloodstains around the sides of the mattress, leading me to believe these weren't the only bed bugs in the place. We left and were refunded the portion of our stay that we didn't use. The rest of place was filthy. I don't know if it had been dusted in the last 10 years and the beds were all sunken in and uncomfortable. It's worth the extra money to not stay in this nasty hotel! The tram system in Amsterdam means it's really easy to stay a little further out of the centraal area and avoid being covered in bites.

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: d-johnson88_7
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews I wanted to cancel my booking. I contacted my travel agency,but I was told I couldn't cancel it because it was a non-refundable booking. I decided to go to Yboulevard hotel anyway. Upon arrival the hotel looked not bad. The lobby was very crowded and it took a while before I could do my check-in. The man behind the reception was nice. I told him I was afraid because of all the bad reviews and he told me to see my room first before deciding to stay or leave. I went up to my room which was on the third floor, room 32. The hotel has no elevator and the stairs didn't seemed very safe!The room had a double bed,a closet,TV,small desk and bathroom. The room was clean,so was the linen. The bathroom was a bit let down and small. It was better than I expected though :) The next morning I went for breakfast. There was not much choice, just bread,ham,cheese,cereals,coffee,tea,milk and cake. The hotel is very average, suitable for students.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom was gross”
Reviews.Author: Janette_FL
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in the basement room under the stairs. It was damp and it stank. The bathroom ceiling was rotting away directly over the shower. There was actually a hole in the middle of a large black patch of mold/mildew. I was afraid something would climb out on top of me in the middle of my shower. UGH!

Reviews.Title: “A Sad State”
Reviews.Author: GuildedLake
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night this week in an ensuite twin room. Location/Exterior. Location is good, just opposite the central station, great for trams, taxis, trains, canal tours and bike hire. Also really easy to walk into the very heart of old Amsterdam. On the down side, the road itself is very busy and traffic noise is high - you cant have it all. The exterior of the building is graffitti marked, which is sad as the building itself is old and very typical of the houses in the area. Check-in/out/service. The guy on duty when we checked in was very warm and friendly, he gave us a free map and showed us where the main area's of interest were, without being asked. Our room was still being cleaned when we arrived but he offered to keep our luggage safe behind his reception desk and asked us to come back. What a thoroughly nice man, we couldnt have asked for better. We were asked for a 10 euro deposit for the room key which was fully returned when we left. Check out was easy, hand in the key, collect your deposit and say goodbye. The only other member of staff we saw was a lady who wandered around between reception and the breakfast room smoking and leaving a trail of ash behind her. Breakfast. Bread/toast/cereals/meat/cheese/jam/coffee/orange & apple juice - nothing high quality, but adequate, fresh and plenty of it set in what was obviously once a very handsome room. Some stunning oil paintings - with water damage, beautiful chandeliers alas the whole thing was tired and in need of some love. One thing of note is that one resident had a large dog staying with him and the dog seemed really happy with the breakfast room - I'm a dog lover, but even I'm not too keen to share breakfast with dogs. Room. Ewwwwwwwwwww, yuk!!!! twin room with ensuite. The heating was on full blast - I mean it was like a sauna, unbearable.... but we found the radiator valve and turned it off, so no problem there. The room was at the front on the second floor, so high traffic noise - but hey, it's in a city not rural. The beds were very old - not antique just old and much used. The floor of the room sloped very badly so it felt like sleeping on the side of a hill. Wardrobe, TV and Desk very old, but they served their purpose - even though the slope on the floor meant the TV was on an accute angle!. Bed linen was laundered and fresh - no complaints there. Mattress old and worn - but no sign of creepy crawlies. The room was dust free and had been cleaned to a point. The room was severely in need of redecoration, since there were some dubious stains on the walls - squished bugs?? The bathroom has old fittings that are watermarked, no amount of scrubbing is going to bring them up shining. The shower head was broken and handing from a piece of string - but it worked. The tiled bathroom floor was damaged very badly and as such was not safe to walk in without shoes - I have to conclude that it is not safe to shower here because of the risk of cutting your feet on the broken floor tiles. One other word of caution - the stairs are precipitous, take ropes and climbing gear, in fairness, the stairs are not in poor repair and are not the worst I assailed whilst there. I wouldn't book for a return visit, my personal view is that if they spent less overheating the hotel and more on renovation/refurbishment then it would be a sweeter place to stay - so sad as this building was once lovely and has the potential to be so again.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: C0nners
Reviews.Content: We had to change the room as the first one given was a dungeon. The secon one was not far off. The bedroom smelled, the room was not clean. The service at reception was poor. The cleaners left the door unlocked whilst we were out. Never stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. It's nearby the Central Station. The bathroom isn't clean, but the rest is nice. The price is reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: PamW321
Reviews.Content: This is a wretched hotel. I've stayed in better youth hostels. The positive elements of our stay at this dump were the breakfast,(simple standard Continental but plenty of it), and the clean sheets.Be warned though, this is the minimum that a guest should expect. In no way does it mitigate against the rest of the tip. It's hard to know where to start. It's clear that the place has changed hands since the web pictures were posted, and was run down/has been run down since then. It's being milked for all its worth. It's tatty, dirty and very very basic, with a wonderful mahogany bar in reception. Just the bar itself that's wonderful. It's a big typically Dutch bar but unlike most other bars, it has no stock. They have no licence, so it's used to store luggage. The rooms have dirty walls and carpets, heaven knows what's hiding in the bathrooms and under the beds The furniture is broken and the mirror in our room was a wardrobe door leaning on the wall. The fabric of the building is failing and work, (starting at 0700), was taking place on the roof. Water has ingressed on ceilings and walls, and part of the window frame fell out in the room next to us. Got the picture? Just avoid it. Pay a bit more and go elsewhere. Oh, and contrary to Dutch law, the staff think it's ok to smoke in the public rooms. middle of the night in the room next to us. dirty walls and carpetsare

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. Horrendous!”
Reviews.Author: like_my_hols
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two friends the night before we ran the Amsterdam marathon. We were in room 23 which was filled with bunk beds. First impression was an old and tired reception area (website completely out of date pictures must have been taken 20 years ago). Outside our room smelt of urine. Inside was worse. Bedding appeared reasonably clean and after trying to find another hotel nearby unsuccessfully we got an early night and just prayed we would sleep. We couldn't face using the shower. During the night we were woken by rustling sounds. Around 6am we got up to discover something (a mouse or rat) had eaten a chocolate bar and flapjack which were sealed and were going to be our post race snack! Then we spotted the bed bugs climbing the walls. We complained to reception who were not bothered at all and would not refund any of our money. We left and I am hoping this place gets shut down. It is a disgrace and should not be in business. I understand there is a lower end of the market to cater for but I would not want my worst enemy to stay here. I had 3 bites when I got home. Disgusting!!!! Do not stay. Unfortunately I read trip advisor when I got back. Hope you read this before you go and you book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in amazing city”
Reviews.Author: Jermies A
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact of had read a lot of bad previews of the hotel but amazingly it was really good hotel we went me and 4 of my friends first week of october and t was really great we had amazing time as first time to amsterdam :D the reception team was great and the rooms are quiet clean not that bad at all breakfast was good also in general we had really a pleasant stay :D and we going to come actually on new years eve again to the same hotel and hope to have great time in that amazing city :D

Reviews.Title: “RATS IN THE ROOMS AND MOULD ALSO HOLES IN THE WALL!”
Reviews.Author: sara168
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel threw budget places this was the first holiday me and my boyfriend have had together so we wanted it to be nice and as long as we had a clean respectable hotel we was going to be happy but that was far from the case when we arrived our first impression was that we thought it was ok not the best but stayable! but that was deafinatly NOT true we got in our room the curtains had been pulled acroos to cover a hole in the wall that the hotel staff had filled up with old magazines at frist we jus thought it was a hole so we took no notice at all untill the 3rd night of our stay when a rat woke me and my boyfriend up at 6am in the morning in our suitcase chewing threw the bag it made several holes in our bag and scratched some of our clothes we had a bin in our room that the rat took rubbish out of an chewed threw a bin bag that the cleaner had not took down there was tiny bits of EMPTY RAPPERS THAT HAD NO FOOD IN JUST OLD rappers from the bin all over the floor and a few droppings on our bed!!! the toielt was not clean at all my boyfriend could not stand up in there as the celling was so low this was room 44 once all this we could not stay in this room I was very emotional an my boyfriend was very angry we went to reception an told a lady that was on her mobile phone that our room had rats and a hole in the wall filled with magazines she replyed by sayin "what do you expect it is a zero star hotel " which was a LIE as on budget places.com it tells me its a 3 star she moved our room to room 33 which she told us was in a bad condition but they would move us in the morning as this was 1am we went to room 33 and it was just as bad a dirty smelly room with bed bugs in this one the toilet was grimy an filthy the beds were uncomfortable and the paint work was disgraceful! there was mould and damp all over the walls very bad believe me ive not seen anything like this before, we did not sleep all that night and the next morning got 160 euros back and booked a new BETTER CLEAN NICE hotel with no rats and kind staff! I will be taking this furter as it was a complete joke and i feel paying 575.45 euro for hotel y boulavard was a rip off i would not even pay 100 euros for this hotel. We DO NOT have one good thing to say about this hotel it was the WORSET hotel i have ever stayed in and deafinatly would not stay there again please read this and believe us as we didnt believe the reviews and wish we would have!!!!!!!! I ONLY CAME BACK YESTERDAY SO WILL ADD PHOTOS SOON.

Reviews.Title: “poor quality”
Reviews.Author: clewsyc
Reviews.Content: this hotel was basic and not very clean ,we were very disapointed with it although it was in a good location the rooms didnt match the pictures on internet

Reviews.Title: “Basically, a drug den”
Reviews.Author: T0Ge
Reviews.Content: If you are one of those people who prefer their beds lice-free, their ceilings fungus-free and their bathrooms pubic hair-free don't stay at this hotel. And, if like me, you do not care to get asked whether you want to buy drugs every time you walk up or down the stairs of the hotel, you'd better stay well clear from this hotel. On top of this, there are serious issues with fire safety (no emergency exits/lighting/signs) and electrical safety (exposed electrical wires in the room). Why this hotel has not been shut down is a mystery to me.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go There, Ugh! Jenny S.Yorks”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam many times with no concerns and satisfied with our accommodation. We chose this hotel (or should I say doss house) due to it's proximity to the center and based on photos which really bear no relation to the reality. We only stayed one night but that was enough. The room was an attic room. Nowhere to put clothes just two beds with marked bed linen and two dirty dinning style chairs, no TV. Couldn't face using the shower since there was an unpleasant stench in the shower room. Bar wasn't open and reception area dirty. Ended up sleeping with a chair wedged against the door as we felt it wasn't necessarily a safe place. Scaffolding blocking the opening of our window. Dirty staircase with broken banisters and no lift. Chipped breakfast cup. The whole place was dirty, worn and shabby. I couldn't wait to get home to wash the place off me. I wouldn't go back if someone paid me.Stay there at your peril.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Muhammed A
Reviews.Content: Oh My Word, stayed 2 nights at this hotel and vowed my self never ever to stay in this place. I read reviews on this place and was abit sceptical about it but when I saw the place my horrors came true! I couldn't care less about recpetion not being nice & clean etc etc. Wheni entered the room the smell was of damp! There was crack in the ceiling, window woudn't close properly, toilet door broken, dust every where, sink water would clear so it got blocked. I've shivering whilst i write this review! I will definetly check on TripAdvisor before i book a hotel again. The only good thing about this hotel (???) was it's location. The stairs were dangerous for my little boy. It really was a nastly place to stay. I felt guilt for putting my wife and child through the horror of staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “blood”
Reviews.Author: martin d
Reviews.Content: if your passion is a room from which you can study the behaviour of bed bugs engorged with bood then this beauty is for you! watching these little devils negotiate the dog/cat /rat haired infested bedding was a trully mind blowing experience!!! The walls were splattered with the remains of demised bugs who were no doubt trying to escape the squalid conditions! i have stayed in amsterdam on numerous occaisions in many different class hotels but this was deplorable, so much so that we left we no alternative accomadation sorted out ,a bench in central station was more appealing!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skyblueUKMidlands
Reviews.Content: This is just an awful place to stay. Room was filthy and had an unpleasant odour, breakfast was very basic and served by an incredibly unhelpful lady. to top it off i returned from my weekend stay and have found several bed bug bites. At roughly 70 euros a night it wasnt exactly cheap but this is without doubt the worst hotel i have had the displeasure of staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Holy God!”
Reviews.Author: LydiaR3
Reviews.Content: This place prides itself on being the worst hotel ... Its def not a hotel as the name suggests, I booked a family dorm, for 6 adults, we were given six single beds jammed into a tiny room with a bathroom without a door handle and the extractor fan broken, the heat was horrific and the smell in the bathroom was sickening. while the tv worked, and the beds were comfortable and the bedding was clean, towels provided were no bigger than face cloths. over all the hotel was dirty and run down in every area, staff didnt want to be there either, one blonde lady on reception was nice , helpful and friendly. breakfast was ok, but the cold hard boiled eggs were a bit of a worry. its not the cheapest place either,, so come on hotel y get the place into sum shape, it was a beautiful building yrs ago and its not a long walk from the city center.... would def not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Well Clear!!”
Reviews.Author: KevJW
Reviews.Content: Booked several rooms for a stag do but would have expected a half descent clean room. The hotel is dirty and scruffy and the rooms range from awful downwards. The room we stopped in was neither secure or clean with a poor bathroom, broken windows, water staining on the sealing, plates missing from plug sockets..... To be honest I could go on all night! In summary calling the place a s#*?hole is is being kind! Need I say more!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location,but dirty”
Reviews.Author: Priscila_Garibaldi
Reviews.Content: The location is very good (10 min walking from the tram/train station),close to a great nightlife, shops, bars, restaurants, fast foods, coffee shops etc. The staff is helpful. But this is not a hotel. Itâ€™s much more like a youth hostel. The problem we found is that itâ€™s very dirty (towels and linen have brown spots all over, garbage from the previous guests is not thrown out, dirt on the carpet, muggy). No bed bugs as some people have posted, but we heard something was trying to eat our snacks at night (rats?) â€“ maybe thatâ€™s why they put those sings all over the hotel: â€œdonâ€™t bring food to the roomsâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Rubbish everything else!”
Reviews.Author: Crossouttherys
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to stay in a decent location and somewhere to put your head for a few hours a night then this is the place for you. If you are after a clean room and a decent breakfast then this is not the palce to go. Just got back from a 3 night stay- we had breakfast once and it was poor so we just ate out after that. The room was very stuffy, the bed dirty and there was a mouse scuttling about the room on the first night. Oh yeah, there was also a pair of knickers on the floor when we arrived. Im not so sure about the bed bugs, but its not a very clean place. At the end of the day, its Amsterdam. Most of the places you will stay will end up being of a poor standard when compared to Hotels elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service not great, facilities appalling”
Reviews.Author: Alan R
Reviews.Content: This place is basically just shocking. We arrived to find that our three-night stay was actually going to cost Â£100 more than anticipated (cost us Â£140 per person for 4 of us for a three night stay). We were then shown up to our room, which contained 5 beds just randomly strewn around the place. The bedding was clean and in fairness it wasn't a bad night's sleep, quiet enough, but the bathroom was poor quality and the breakfast and service during was awful. It was in a convinient location, close to the central station and the bars, but by the sounds of things there are far better hotels available for what isn't that low a price. I'd struggle to recommend this place to anyone to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY, unless you want BED BUGS, poor service, and a worn out room.”
Reviews.Author: MikkelSaxild
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam well knowing that we hadn't booked a 5 star hotel, but at an average price of 100 euro a night, we at least expected a clean room and acceptable service. We didn't get that. First of all we couldn't use our credit card to pay like we were told. In our room we found a few blood stains on the walls which looked like smeared mosquitoes and the carpets were old and didn't seem like they had been changed in the last 50 years. The sheets looked clean though, and that was the most important thing to us. It turned out, that the bed WASN'T clean!!!! What we got from our stay was around 150 bedbug bites. When we took a look at the sheets we found 3 dead bed bugs and one live one. We brought the bugs down to the reception, but the receptionist just said that it was what you would expect in an old building and talked to us in an arrogant fashion. He didn't see how this could ever be his problem. When we asked to speak to the manager, we were the told that we could come back in 2 hours if we wanted to talk to the him, but that he probably wouldn't do anything either. Weâ€™ve never experienced worse service and hope that this review will make you think about booking a room in this place one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Done the job.”
Reviews.Author: elfouly42
Reviews.Content: +, The beds were comfortable , the linen clean , the furniture utilitarian at best, the shower fixing broken but loads of powerful refreshing hot water , the location ten minutes from the central station and overlooking canal, the staff more than helpful , the breakfast more than enough to get through the day. Don't expect too much and be pleasantly surprised . Probably the best value for money you'll find in rip off Amsterdam. - rooms are bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, but facilities and rooms were a let-down”
Reviews.Author: chadd3
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Amsterdam without any accommodation, finding any hostel in which to stay was top priority. We booked into Y Boulevard through a hotel/hostel-booking centre on the Damrak. We arrived at the hostel knowing we wouldn't be able to check in 'til 2 o'clock in the day so left our bags behind reception and headed into town. When we returned at 2, we were told the room wouldn't be ready for another 2 hours which was pretty annoying considering we hadn't slept the night before and needed just a few hours sleep before hitting the town again. That aside, the reception staff we encountered were perfectly friendly. We were in a shared room of about 20 odd people with one toilet/shower whose door had a great big window pane missing, meaning privacy was not an option for those needing the loo or a quick shower. Also, half the time the water was cold, so not a very pleasant shower experience. Rooms are very grubby, beds are almost squashed together meaning you barely had any space to get changed or keep your bags next to your bed. Aside from that, sleep quality was good, no hassle if you're planning to spend most of the night out. Not entirely comfortable with the fact that room door is kept unlocked all day and no keys are given out. Aside from all this, hostel was generally okay, never had breakfast so can't remark on that. Because I generally travel on a very low budget, I would recommend people to this hostel who don't care for anything fancy and just want somewhere to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place ~ ever”
Reviews.Author: JDFakaTheHardcolico
Reviews.Content: Hello to all. This is probably one (or THE one) of the worst place to stay in amsterdam (for the kind of sistemation) *Room type & consideration: Ten people's room with private bathroom: 4th floor, no elevator. The room is really really small (it will ok for 6 people max for me) with a small desk with tv on it, no seat. Bed are really close two on two (max 40cm far). The upper bed are too close to the ceiling and your risk is to hit the girder (crossbeam) with head during the night! The mattress and the linen looks like dirty and much dusty: during the night you have difficult to breathe in. The ground are dirty too and i think that the cleanliness is not really done. The electric circuit is at high risk! *Bathroom: really small, with one washbasin and no window. The shower? Short! If you are more than 150 cm.... Water temperature is difficult to balance (broken faucet) *Breakfast: (low hygiene for me): you take all with your (dirty) hand. All you can eat. Bread, rusk, marmelade (3 types), butter, orange juice, water, coffe and tea. Oven to warm up your bread. We ask to have more orange juice but a girl who work here asked us it was finished....but we see it in the back of kitchen and when we exit from the breakfast room we see it on the table!! *Services: the night man receptionist is crazy. Generally the liking is not high. We had a problem but they did'nt resolve. *Other: our trip were horrible in this place! Worst place ever in 18 years of prowl! We hav'nt the light during the stay! No electricity for more than 24hr!! We use the bathroom with the lights of mobile phone. We ask them but none happends: no room change, no sales but only a torch was give to us.... We asked them that we want our money back: they laught....when i talk to him that i call the police his smile goes away from the face. *Price: 37â‚¬ per night in this kind of room for one people with no really service offer is really a rip-off. The payment at arrival in pratice are not refundable although you want to change after your first night. For me: Worst place ever in 18 years of wandering in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug bites”
Reviews.Author: cruiseboy2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel y Boulevard from Wednesday the 8th of June to Saturday the 11th of June 2011. Entering the Hotel it looked shabby and unkept but we understood that we had got the Hotel on a budget. We entered the room and found that the Toilet door handle was hanging off, the shower head had no mount and the sink was leaking all over the bathroom floor. The bedding however seemed very clean and the sheets stain free, thank goodness. Having stayed the first night, I thought I was having an allergic reaction to something, I started getting spots up and down my arm and across my back. I took some Antihystamines as I have sensitive skin and thought nothing of it until we finally got home, I saw a colleague of mine who looked at the spots and said that they were bed bug bites. Looking at other reviews and seeing my doctor, this confirmed that I had actually been bitten whilst staying in this hotel. There are two lessons I have learned and that if your going to stay in Amsterdam or any other Capital city, do not go on a budget, itÂ´s simply not worth it and never stay in that pitiful excuse of a Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the photos!!”
Reviews.Author: Mallyjoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked for three nights but stayed just the first night... to avoid paying the cancellation fee. It's not really a hotel in the 21st Century meaning of the word, more of a 1960's style hostel before the advent of Health and Safety Laws. The establishment is crying out for investment but that is unlikely to happen, we were reliably informed by a local, because the owners are former Chinese restaurant owners who are looking to make easy money now that the bottom has fallen out of the Chinese food trade in Amsterdam. The price of 137 euros for one night and the exorbitant booking fee of 41 euros is daylight robbery. For a few euros more we spent the remaining two nights in a four star hotel near Rembrandt Square and had a wonderful holiday.Oh nearly forgot... we discovered later that the hotel was voted seventh in 'Europe's Dirtiest Hotels' league of shame!

Reviews.Title: “Rat-tastic mildew palace”
Reviews.Author: NMPitre
Reviews.Content: 11 words: Snicker's bar left behind discovered under bed half-eaten by RATS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well it is a hostel... but the most rundown i've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: akp_va
Reviews.Content: I know that you can't always expect much out of a hostel and I am actually really not picky but this place was so rundown. First, to find our room was a maze, it was actually kinda funny because there were two other parties searching for their rooms also and we just kept passing each other. I still don't understand thr layout, there were rickety, should be condemned stairs leading all ove the place. Then our room, paint peeling from the walls. A dirty sock under the bed. Oh and worst of all, the shower!! It barely dripped out and basically you had to put your head against the wall it was running down. I would say this is the perfect place for young hen or stag parties that really don't care about their hotel but I'm too old for that I guess.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as you think!”
Reviews.Author: Becca_Hughes18
Reviews.Content: I was reading the reviews from before and had to stick up for the Hotel Y boulevard. I went to Amsterdam in a group of four girls. We came for a site sighting break with a bit of nightlife. We are all students. Our hotel room was pretty basic, which was all we needed for our holiday. Our bed covers were completely clean, our shower was functioning, as were all our lights and the staff were very friendly to us. We were asked every morning if our room wanted a clean and if our towels were to be changed. The breakfast was also basic but did however give us enough energy for our whole day. The location of the hotel was very good, we were a 10 minute walk from the station and the central Amsterdam square. I believe if you just want a place to have a good nights sleep after a long day, this hotel is more than adequate to provide you with this. If however, you are looking for a romantic break with a partner it would probably be best to find a hotel with more character.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible night receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTheVegetarian
Reviews.Content: The man who checked in my girlfriend, who arrived an hour after me, was incredibly rude to her & was quite frankly very insulting! She noted that there is no way she would feel comfortable there by herself. The room and bathroom were sub-standard and were ill maintained. The receptionist during the day was pleasant & the breakfast was not too bad. My opinion-avoid.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place to think not to stay!”
Reviews.Author: safariethiopia
Reviews.Content: I am my wife are an experinced business travelers who also owns our own travel company. We hve frequesntly been to Europe and our choices are not fancy or very poor property but mid size Value tp money type of hotels. on our recent trip to Holland (which is not our first but may be 5th or 6th), we went to a web page booking.com and get to know this hotel called Hotel Y-Boulevard Amsterdam located few kilometers from the central train station. On the web page the information about the hotel is very wrong and the web page which is promoting this ruined dustbin looking property should find out the reality. our first impression was very bad. by the time we entered the room, it was under construction and a dust was falling from the roof; every where in the room is dirty, the light is broken, the roof lets in water and the ceiling is totally distroyed, continiously the washroom water is flowing; the bath is broken and handlings faded out, doors could not close at all............they charged us 170.00 Euro and were not willing a all to give back. the are lairs and could not be in the hospitality industry at all. i am wondering fi there is any government body in Netherlands that gives grading to such firms.

Reviews.Title: “The Hostel Part 3”
Reviews.Author: sootys
Reviews.Content: I was with the party of people who have already written their comments about this disgusting hell hole and the following is my views on this place which quite frankly should be shut/burnt down. We arrived in the afternoon and were told the rooms would not be ready until 4, so we came back again later and were told it would not be ready again until 7, i questioned why and they wouldnt give any reason, after pestering them they agreed to let us use one of the rooms to get a shower, this is when the state of the hotel became apparent. When walking through the hotel all the locks, doors and casing had been smashed off, after walking into the room they let us use, all the drawes had also been pulled out. (What had gone in this hotel we thought!!!!) After seeing this and the state and smell of the room (which smelt like it hadnt been cleaned for years) & the police outside the hotel, there was no way we were going to stay in this cesspit. We informed the hotel manager that we wanted our money back and she had the cheek to try and deduct money for having a shower in their dirty smelly room (As if we would have got a shower in here!!!), which we politely told her no chance!!!! A full refund was given, but i would not recommend this hotel as it is clear something dodgy is going on and if we would have stayed there i wouldnt be writing this review now!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Death by Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMacBe
Reviews.Content: Ditto the below review, I was part of the same group. I don't normally write reviews as can't be bothered but this hotel compelled me to. As mentioned they told us we wouldn't be able to check in until 7pm as they were changing some doors but they agreed to let us use a room to shower in which was on the top floor. As we went up each floor no rooms had doors on and workmen were also replacing door frames, this was a Friday night so don't believe they'd schedule maintenance at such a time. No one would explain what had happened so can only assume that it had being raided by the police looking for something/someone maybe drugs or Bin Laden (he'd be better sticking to caves they're much nicer). In the room were 5 or 6 ramshackle metal beds impressively laid out in an un organized manner. A wardrobe unit with drawers pulled out and some missing. Rotten mildew ridden window frames with i think glass in but could have being some kind of fungal membrane. A bathroom that you would think had not being cleaned since the days of Anne Frank. I wouldn't have felt safe staying here with a armed guard. The only good thing i can say about the hotel was its location as within a 5mins walking distance from it we found a tourist/hotel information place and had another hotel recommended and booked within 15mins. And just to sum it up, when we told the guy where we had come from he laughed and said they always have people coming in after walking out of the Y Boulevard. BOOK THIS HOTEL AT YOUR PERIL.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: dessiepoo
Reviews.Content: That last "review" was not written by an Irish person, the English is so bad. Possibly a Dutch person? Probably the owners!! This hotel is listed as one of the Top 10 Dirtiest Hotels in Europe by Tripadvisor and deservedly so. Obviously the tourist authorities in Amsterdam have very low standards to allow this hellhole to operate. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, dirty, dangerous, unsafe, and nothing like the advertised pictures!”
Reviews.Author: cyril001
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting room, nothing like the one in the picture. We had to go up four flights with the last flight of stairs very narrow and dangerous. Door was unsafe, door handle not secure. Room was dirty. Bathroom was old and tatty, no toilet paper or soap. There was however a stained and very holey hand towel neatly folded. We didnt stay the night, we thought the room totally unsafe. My advice would be to avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: DitteZach
Reviews.Content: We had bedbugs and had to move. I tried to have our payment refunded but management refused. I wrote a complaint when I came home, and they replied that of course they would return my payment. BUT THEY NEVER DID!

Reviews.Title: “Run away from it !!”
Reviews.Author: lugheir
Reviews.Content: Rooms dirty, (bugs in the sheets), sometime without windows. Shower out of order (water may come into the bedroom). Unpleasant staff. Very low value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “y oh y did we choose the Hotel Y Boulevard?”
Reviews.Author: bumfacebooy
Reviews.Content: lets take the hotels description and break it down and put it in to real terms "The friendly atmosphere and the classy interior offers the visitors exceptional comfort." maybe for the original 17th centuary occupants. "All the rooms have colour tv with cable" yes i believe they do; but ours relentlessly mimicked a small explosion every 30 seconds and drove us to near insanity. When we finally plucked up the courage to complain (we'll get on to friendly staff in moment) we finally got a replacement TV that had to be carried by my boyfirend up 6 flights of stairs up from the basement our room in the gods of the hotel "Hotel Y Boulevard offers budget accommodation l Â£113.00per night (unlucky for some) .this is a budget hotel Budget hotel with City five star prices " With our personalized service you will automatically feel at home." well in fairness they did find us a replacement TV (see above) a special phone call was made to the boss who persuaded th receptionist to have a rummage in the basement antiques and bust out the 1980's portable reserved for emergencies look i dont want to go on. Time is a passing . All in all this place is just not worth the money. Amsterdam is expensive, way over the top. it has lost its charm and hotelS such as these add to the discomfort. appaulling conditions and taking the micky. The staff are not upleasant but suffer from tourist fatique.

Reviews.Title: “s**t hole”
Reviews.Author: nwhclub
Reviews.Content: to say this is by far the worst hotel i have stayed in would be an understatement the description and photo`s on the web pages make it look o.k but they are totally missleading this hotel should be removed from the planet !! it does not represent a 17th century merchants house as stated but more like a doss house for vagrants ...it is falling to pieces, dirty , smelly, has carpets that i wouldn`t wipe my feet on , showers that you wouldn`t wash your dog in , beds that you sleep on not in ,and dont walk out of the front door in the morning for a stroll without paying as the albanian/morrocan/eastern uropean mafia hotel owners/ staff dont like it BE WARNED DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL i did and its s**t { sorry its the only word that fits}

Reviews.Title: “unclean”
Reviews.Author: rachyandy
Reviews.Content: this hotel wasn't the best, bedsheets weren't very clean, bathroom was dirty, shower was horrible, and the place needs a bit of work in general. on the positive side there was free breakfast, the location was good and it was easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLE, SMALL BUT CONVENIENT”
Reviews.Author: sydneywebshopper
Reviews.Content: Okay. so there are a few things to note about hotels in Europe ... generally their Star-Rating differs greatly to what the Star-Rating in Australia is, generally your expectations should be set a little lower so as not to disappoint yourself. The double room we opted for was exactly that, just a double room - we also opted for one with a private bathroom. The room was very, very basic - double bed, robe with just enough hanging space for 5 large jackets/coats and tv (the tv did have satellite so you could watch programs both in Dutch and English) and it had working heating in the room. Our room faced main the road and we didn't think that it was that noisy (I've read a few other reviews complaining about the excessive noise); just close your window and draw the curtains. We also had views of the Music Hall and I think NEMO (the Science Centre) was not too far from us as well. We also opted for breakfast which was pretty good - choice of bread, cheese, cereal, boiled eggs, coffee/tea/OJ and a selection of other tasty treats, well worth the extra 6euro from memory. Another thing to note is that there is NO lift/elevator in this building - our room was on the top floor - which was about 6 flights of stairs up - we would highly recommend purchasing a backpack if travelling through Europe as most of these older establishments do not have lifts and lugging a 20kg suitcase is not very fun at all. The hotel is old, probably in need of refurbishment very, very soon but despite this, it is well situated to all of the Attractions, in walking distance to the main train station. When you come out of the train station, walk straight out and look for the street ''PRINS HENDRIKKADE'' (it runs parrallel to the train station) - if you have your back to the train station, walk left on Prins Hendrikkade; it will about 10-15 minute walk from there. The room was priced right and had the basic amenities - I would only recommend to certain types of travellers, those not so interested in the 5 star treatment but rather, budget conscious. Amsterdam can be an expensive city ... there's a place called the Soup Kitchen on the street ''Nieuwendijk'' and they do great Sweet Potato soup and the Mushroom soup is great also, great to warm up your belly on those very cold Dutch nights. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “grand for young people..”
Reviews.Author: sparmac
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not as bad as all the reviews say. i was in 2 different rooms in this hotel and both were clean. if u r just lookin for sum were to sleep this is perfect. 5 min walk to redlight district and 3 min walk to the closest coffe shop..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maaureen
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a central location, we had 2 double rooms both the same bad quality, carpets all stained and frayed, bad smell in bathrooms, i would not walk about in my bear feet for fear of catching something, did not use the shower for same reason, all areas needed repainted and carpet throughout, this hotel would even be considered poor quality by backpackers, Lots of stairs in all directions very steep and carpets all frayed, handrails broke etc etc. on the plus side any staff we met were all very friendly and the housekeeping/cleaning team did hoover, clean etc but they were fighting a loosing battle whole place needs revamp. Breakfast - contential could not complain, cereal, toast, cheese, ham, boiled eggs, juice, tea, coffee good and plenty of it. hotel was warm no problem there, no sign of air con for summer time if you go then. Also cost of hotel was taking from my visa before i arrived which incured me extra charge, when the card was only susposed to be for security, they also charge 20 euro for hotel key but you get this back at end of stay, so fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “Why didnt we read trip advisor reviews before we booked into Y Boulevard!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojo68NorthLondon
Reviews.Content: Although the staff we encountered were friendly this "hotel" was way way below the standard we were expecting! It is shabby, unkempt and looks as though it hasnt been cleaned properly for years. The stairs are extremely steep and the frayed carpet is a broken neck just waiting to happen as are the wobbly banisters. 3rd floor room was stifling hot and the windows would not stay open unless we wedged them with paper. there are NO wardrobes and our shower head fitting was broken so that it would not fix to the wall. On the plus side the beds were comfy and the sheets smelt and felt freshly laundered. We never attempted breakfast as the smell wafting up the stairs was awful. This is a truly horrendous place to stay so our advice is DONT!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Funny”
Reviews.Author: Diva88
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 of us (uni friends) stayed here in November 2009 for 2 nights. 5 in one room and 4 in another. The bigger room was erm 'OK', but the 4 bed room we were given was 2 bunk beds, with no ladders or sides. The room was freezing, and had cig dimps all over the floor. We asked to change rooms, and he showed us another which was hilarious it had graffiti ALL over the walls and scratched into the wood, but we thought it was a little better so had that one. There was a rentokil rat trap in there too!! We saw the funny side of it though, we had only gone to amsterdam for the usual... getting really drunk and stuff, so we didn't mind too much. We only went in there to sleep, shower and get changed. Give breakfast a miss too!! Amsterdam is amazing though, so if you're going, maybe find somewhere a little nicer to stay!

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: Onderlegger
Reviews.Content: You get the feeling that the building can collapse every moment. Rooms are not clean, and the inside of the building needs a complete remake.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT SAY HERE...You will be dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: reliable1
Reviews.Content: A run down smelly building. I think we relied too much on the internet pictures without checking trip advisor first. We (myself & 2 friends) requested with the booking 'high floor,early check in) we recieved 1st floor and told to come back at 2pm for check in. Although a warm welcome from teh receptionist, the reception/bar area was smelly and old. When we recieved our room key,we had trouble getting in. On entering our room we were overwelmed by the smell and state of the room. Checking the rest of the room, we came across a used plaster on the floor,cigerettes, paper, litter and drug bags under the beds. The bed sheets had blood stains on and the duvet covers all suffered similar stains. The bedroom window didnt close properly (not good being on the first floor), mould on the bathroom tiles,hairs still on and around the drainage area, no lock on the bathroom door...i can go on. We stayed for 1 night as we couldnt get refunded for the first night stay, after which we moved to the Nova Hotel (RECOMMENDED FOR THE SAME PRICE), a palace compared to 'Y Boulevard' . It didnt ruin our stay...Amsterdam is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hostel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DDazman
Reviews.Content: I could not believe this place advertises as a hostel.... Arrived it seemed ok - down a flight of stairs and room seemed clean and comfortable but small sharing a large 14 or so person dorm When I got back very late after heading out on the town I arrived in hell..... The bathroom light did not work so a shower ended up out of the question but I managed to go to the bathroom. Then early the next morning, a guy is smoking in the room - and the room only has one small window at the end. I also heard large banging noises, and laughing - didn't think anything of it until I got up the next morning. Upon awakening I wanted to have a shower and the bathroom stunk or urine. I figure that guys getting up in the middle of the night managed to miss the toilet ball and to top it off there was no sign of a floor waste vent. I also notice that the shower holder (shower is one of the hose versions with a wall holder) had been broken off the wall. I figure that someone trying to have a shower in the dark falls and trys to hold on to the holder which breaks off. This also explains the large banging noises and laughter. I finally have my shower though it was painful. To top it off, after chatting with some room mates, one finds that the light bulb had been removed from the light in the bathroom - that explained that light working the day before and not later. I'm so glad I only stayed one night. On checking out I also overhear complaints about other hotel rooms in the hotel section. My advice - just don't stay here - it is dirt cheap but I recommend paying a few extra dollars, it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: HonestReviewsEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at around 10.30 am, we expected our room to be ready and to check in as soon as we got there but this didn't happen, we had to wait around for 3 hours until the room had been cleaned and ready for us (when booking it on the internet they asked what time we would be arriving, which was pointless because the room still wasn't ready when we got there). The owner shown us to our room which was at the end of a long corridor, the only room in this corridor, other rooms consisted of shared toilets and the cleaners room which both gave of horrible smells. When we enetered our room, our first impressions were far from good, it smelt musty and didn't look clean atall, most of the plug sockets didn't work and there was a clump of hair inside one of the cabinets. We complained to the manager and asked for our money back but he said this wasn't possible so we then asked to change rooms, he said there were no more rooms available. However, other poeple who we knew were staying in the same hotel, and they told us after that they complained and got to change rooms so there were other rooms available afterall. We stayed for 2 nights and each night we were woken up by poeple that worked there shouting to each other and at 5.30am they seemed to be carrying boxes in through the door next to our room, talking loudly and banging with no consideration for guests. Horrible hotel do not book to stay here, rooms are far from clean and staff are rude.

Reviews.Title: “The worst, ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: abyzz
Reviews.Content: We went for a 3 night stay at this hotel. We ended up with 15 min. This is the worst â€œthingâ€� I ever seen. DON`T BOOK !!!!! They even took full payment before the stayâ€¦. So my stay cost me dobble.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for undemanding, young people”
Reviews.Author: Fabens
Reviews.Content: Location is great, you can walk anywhere from the hostel. I was in a shared room. Towel and bed sheets was included and washed. Be sure to mark your bed with your name, though. We found some other guests in our bed when we returned home. It wasn't a big deal. Overall it was a nice experience. What is most important to me is cleanliness and there you couldn't complain. Breakfast was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of stairs”
Reviews.Author: cbkr11
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the price and it was near, five blocks, from the Centraal Station. Location is really good. It is an old biulding, and the stairs are almost dangerous! Very narrow for sure. The breakfast is average, just ok. Our room was big enough. needs to be repainted. Bathroom ok. Better that a youth hostel but it is an old hotel, just get some sleep and have your shower in private. If you are young go for it!

Reviews.Title: “There are far better”
Reviews.Author: ohsod1t
Reviews.Content: I had booked two single rooms for a one night stay. On arrival I was happily told that all single rooms had gone and we would get a really big room each. This sounded great until I opened my door to a dirty dormitory with bunk beds. I found it difficult to sleep due to the endless comings and goings of late night revlers going through the door outside the room. I've stayed in Amsterdam many times, and on this budget you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “hated the hotel and all Amesterdam because of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graber
Reviews.Content: poor maintinance,bad smell all over the hotel, breakfast is basic of poor quality, some of the stuff are so agressive and are in the wrong position. The website does not match with the reality. some authority has to stop the sheeting. The only good thing is the place where it is located. it is close to central station. if you do not care about smells, respect, food, furnisher...this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Every Minute”
Reviews.Author: BBKing_8
Reviews.Content: This was a truly AWFUL place to stay. Having read the other reviews I completely agree with how terrible this place is. I only wished I had read them before I booked it! I booked it through a travel website and checked out its own website which is completely DISHONEST and was bitterly disappointed when I arrived there. The room we were first given smelt of sewage and urine, the bathroom was filthy and stained. When I went back down the extremely narrow and steep steps to the reception they offered 4 other sets of keys to choose a room that suited. The only slightly decent space was on the very top floor (up further flights of super steep stairs). This room (which had no room number on it), whilst a little better, was still filthy with a windowsill full of cigarette butts, a dirty table, stained carpet and stains on the sheets. The noise from the street was terrible and the heater continuously had a noisy running water sound - and it wasn't even turned on. Whilst the room had an awful grimey feel, the rest of the place was just as bad, if not worse. There were smashed windows and a courtyard full of wet rubbish, empty bottles and dirty plates - these also lined the corridor. I had booked for 2 nights and only barely managed to stay for one. It ruined my first feeling about Amsterdam. The only redemption is that the city itself is really great. DO NOT STAY HERE - it is not even worth 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Should be closed”
Reviews.Author: fostex
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it is a hostel, and actually that description may be gilding the lily somewhat. Bare wires hanging out of the wall, "V" shaped beds with grubby nylon sheets, doors which did not lock and filthy bathrooms which stank of urine were actually the highlights of this establishment. One of the rooms offered to us actually had 10 beds (including 4 iron bunk beds) in it, and this was booked for a single occupant. Doors to the street has been forced open and had been roughly covered in plywood, sacks of dirty linen adorned the corridors, carpets on stairs has worn right through and gaped open, inviting a rapid decent for the unwary. Travelling on business with a group of co workers, we quickly ascertained that this health and safety risk posing as a hotel should be vacated immediately and walked away. Please donâ€™t stay in this hotel; itâ€™s filthy, insecure and dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: jolantukas11
Reviews.Content: The first thing we've seen was a dirty entrance and a dirty red carpet. The lady at the reception didn't even look at us when we were talking to her. We felt really scared, after leaving our bags behind the reception (because it was too early to check in) we walked around looking for other accommodation. However, it seemed that all the better quality hotels around were fully booked. At the end of the day we needed to come back to this disaster. The guy at the reception met us with a smile, he was nice and polite. He told us that he's got a nice room for us. When we went up the stairs to the fourth floor, we couldn't find our room. When we went down to reception and told them about our problem, the guy went up to show us the room. The reason why we couldn't find a room was, because there was no number on the door. The room was extremely basic, but clean. Except the towels, both towels were dirty, but after showing them to reception we got the apology and new towels of course. The curtains in the room were falling and the corridors were stinky. I wouldn't recomment this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible”
Reviews.Author: emmalou_82
Reviews.Content: We had already booked 3 nights in other hotel for the beginning of the stay and decided to stay on in the city for a few more nights before our flight home. We booked this through the Information point at the Centraal Station., It was quite pricey for two night, just under 170 Euro. It was discusting!! Thread bear carpets, just grimey and quite unpleasant. Our room was on top floor, up three flights(no lift) and up another attic style steep stairs(did we pant!!) Our room was basic to say the least, Ply board ceeling to shower, smell of damp was rank, stained carpets and more ciggy butts (AND THE OTHER) covering the outside of our window ledge. It was just horrible. I would stay clear unless you had no sense of smell or any standards!!!!!! YUCK!

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: freddy88london
Reviews.Content: Having booked prior to arrival, we noticed the very dirty entrance hall and our hearts began to sink. We asked at the desk if we were getting a double room as booked. We were given a choice of two and asked to choose. Up the very steep threadbare dirty carpet to the first floor and opened a room overlooking the front: small, twin beds, filthy shower wet room. When we went to lock the door, we accidently used the wrong key to find that both keys opened the door. Up some more very steep stairs to the next floor, through a maze of several doors before we found the next room number. This room was bigger and overlooked the back with three single beds pushed together. The wardrobe didn't have a door with broken drawers, the net curtain was grey and the carpet badly stained. At least two of the beds looked like they had clean sheets although the one nearest the door looked like the bedding had been used. The wet room had a broken shower head but there was hot water and clean threadbare rough towels every day. In all a very depressing experience and in our opinion, not worth the two stars it has been allocated. Two star hotels in Greece offer far more and we are astonished that this hotel has passed European Community inspection of this standard.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay at The Y Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: wulviken
Reviews.Content: The three of us arrived the hotel just before 2 pm, there we were told that our room (a dorm) would be ready in an or two hour, perhaps! But at least we could leave our luggage there until then. When we came back to the hotel a few houres later there was no problem to check in, our room was on the second floor and when we entered it we were almost shocked! The 10 bed dorm was suddenly transformed to a 17 bed dorm, there were shaky two etage beds everywhere! The crappy bathroom that all 17 person should share had a nice view to a shabby backyard and were full of hair, empty shampoo bottles, a lot of small flies and a shabby bathtub. The dorm was so full of beds that one just only spot the dirty floor a few places. The walls had some damages as well, wires hang out several places, together with the fungus that were growing on both ceiling and walls. We decided to stay because we only had one night in Amsterdam and did not want to waste it on the hostel. But the night were just terrible, the beds started to make noise if one just thought about moving, the air was heavy enough to give most people a severe headache and people were smoking weed on the bathroom during the whole F****** NIGHT! It is a miracle that we all came out of there with our lives and belongings... Did not expect a SAS Radisson, but you can get something much in Amsterdam than this, for the same prize! Follow a good advice and just stay away. Personally I will NEVER come back to The Y Boulevard Hotel, not even if I should be the one who got paid for the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ReportsFromAbroad
Reviews.Content: Useful location but everything else is awful. On arrival we found one bed was damp resulting from a leak above. We were assured this was fixed - that was not true. Each day we returned to find the same leak, only worse each time. Only offered alternative room on the last night when the "hotel" was not so busy. I was promised a 50 euro refund - this never appeared and my e-mails since have not been answered. Don't stay here, there are lots of othere places to stay in Amsterdam and any random choice has got to be better than this!

Reviews.Title: “The photos make it look nice !”
Reviews.Author: pistolp8282
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends stayed in a 3 bed private room. I think I will just list my thoughts Reception staff not very helpful and sometimes quite rude The stairs are like climbing everest Room stank of bleach Mould on the wall Wardrope door hanging off plus an old sock on in the draw 2 electric plugs damaged live wires hanging out No ceiling light just a hanging wire only 1 out of the 4 lights worked Bath room stank of sewage. Tv remote did not work No hook to hold the shower up Cold water or boling hot no inbetween Breakfast consisted of toast/ham/cheese/cornflakes

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Floor... No Bloody Lift”
Reviews.Author: Dazel_London
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located is a nice area, close enough to the dirt and fun of Amsterdam but far enough so that you don't smell it. Our room was on the fourth floor of this ginormous terrace building and lugging my pack all the way up was massive pain. To boot there was a group of 'lads' on their stag weekend staying in the same hotel. Well this is not the hotel's fault but in any case they were annoying. Service was average, the rooms are ordinary, the beds were reasonably comfortable. If this place was slightly cheaper, then I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers beware”
Reviews.Author: abcr2008
Reviews.Content: As is always the case, we booked our hotel on a spur of the moment decision, having read the previous reviews after booking the room. We were a bit concerned with the amount of negative reviews, but decided to go ahead with the booking as surely it cant be that bad, and we had just arrived from Paris were we stayed in a absolutley acceptable cheap hotel complete with bar and patissere, so what really could go wrong? Well let me tell you what went wrong 'Y Boulevard' went wrong. Although close to all the essential things you need to do in amsterdam, please take my warning, this hotel is not for you if you crave things like, adequate acommodation, semi-friendly staff and being delivered wat you were promied (even haf-way is good). Grated this hotel is cheap, but cheap doesnt have to mean awful, for example on arrival after booking a double room (1 double bed) we were supplied with a room that contained two small single beds. This was a shock but decided to perservere due to the cheap price. Now that we had accepted our lot with this hotel, let me tell you what is really was like. Firstly, the room we stayed in had a noticable slant to the floor, enough for you to physically roll to the other side of the room during the night (in your bed ofcourse). Secondly, the bathroom was dirty, soiled and mouldy, not a great advertisement in anyone's langauage. Most importantly, bathroom had the constant smell of rancid sewerage to it. Granted it was winter, but the heating in our room was intolerable and not controllable by the tenant, luckily the window could be opened, which did afford us a great view of the harbour. We received complimentary continential breakfast with our room, sounds nice in practice, but the delivery was awful, stale cheese and ham, horrid filter coffee and not even fresh bread. Apart from the above, this hotel is in a great location, walking distance to where you want to be, but having met friends in Amsterdam who were paying just as much as we were, you can get a much better deal for the same amount of money than this. Don't take this review the wrong way, we are just alerting you to the numerous hazards in staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: Mattsunrise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, also close to the central train station. It had a breakfast served every morning which for the price you pay is excellent. The recpetion is 24hrs and are always helpful. Every evening i came back the room had been cleaned with fresh towels, there was a television with a few english channels but that doesnt matter you dont go to amsterdam to watch tele!!! We paid 90 euros a night between 4 of us for a quad room. You can tell from outside its not going to be a palace. If you want a cheap friendly hotel in a good location ths is the one for you

Reviews.Title: “Housing superpig”
Reviews.Author: willyf0g
Reviews.Content: "It is the most horrible hotel I've ever been. Musty rooms (and not the same as show at internet hotel site), dirty floor, filthy bathrooms, smog smells everywhere, rooms 80 years old, every rooms are noisy, TV was not working. I do not exaggerate. I couldn't change the room because in that case, I have to pay the whole price. They asked 5% of city/tourist tax per room per night more which was not in the booking.com total cost. Also they don't give receipt for dormitory rooms which is needed for tax refunding. please remove this hotel from Amsterdam, or better, from the planet heart"

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: mroche
Reviews.Content: Y Boulevard - Amsterdam February 2008 Arrived very late in the evening due to missing a flight. The receptionist was helpful and very polite. We had booked a double room, only to find that we had five beds in ours. Next morning spoke to the hotel staff who moved us with no problems. The room was comfortable, a good shower. The only downside was the headboard had fallen down. The inclusive breakfast was fine, a reasonable choice of food, juices tea and coffee. The hotel is in need of a little TLC but it suited our requirements, being close to the city centre and the railway station. The luggage storage facility was a godsend on the last day. We would stay their again, after all at the price you pay don't expect 4 or 5 star facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place!”
Reviews.Author: mungo1
Reviews.Content: Don't stay there. They tried to charge us double from what they quoted on the internet. The first room they put us in was sub standard, lights hanging of the wall or not working, tiny room. The second room was not much better. I would look for another hotel don't stay there. Just down the street there is a hotel info shop on Prinshenrikslade. Go there.....there is a nice woman who can fix you up with a good hotel last minute @ cheap prices.

Reviews.Title: “cheap, not the Ritz, good location”
Reviews.Author: Davyth
Reviews.Content: Well when you pay â‚¬40 per person per night in the centre of Amsterdam, you shouldn't expect the Ritz! It was clean and in a good location. Bedroom was small en suite was a good size. The shower was great, nice and powerful, and plenty of hot water. It's a little better than a hostel but for the price it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Underpromised, overdelivered”
Reviews.Author: The_shad0w
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel then decided to check out the comments on this site (ok, not the brightest thing to have done) so wasnt expecting much. In fact I was dreading the stay at the hotel. However, having returned last night I thought I would add my own take on the hotel. Clean enough (fresh towels, clean bed linen - no bed bugs as of yet), friendly staff who helpfully advised not to buy any drugs on the street in Amsterdam, and advised us upon arrival that it was fine to smoke in the rooms, but if you're gonna smoke weed, make sure the windows are open - advice we took on board. Bar stays open until you want to go to bed. Location spot on, 5 minute walk from Central station. No major hassle on paying for the room, we didnt pay until the last night. No issues at all with the place. Admittedly the place isnt the Ritz, but then for 60euro a night, where is? I'd stay there again, great crack.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: englandjamesbond
Reviews.Content: We arrived party of six couples all eager to get to our rooms and freshen up.The property looked very nice from the outside once inside there was a pokey bar area crammed with exotic looking plants and flowers once up the lighhthouse steps we entered our room !!! My god it smelt of urine and was crammed with four single beds, it smelt damp and the bedding was not complete there were pillow cases missing. The toilet did not flush there was no hanging space for clothing no wardrobe, bloody dismal our friends all experienced the same one couple demanded another room HAZARD DO NOT GO THERE !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Disgrace!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fraser00
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY!!!!! After reading the awful reviews posted on her, we thought we would remain optimistic, as we only wanted basic accommodation. Stuck on the 3rd floor which was clearly a smoking room after having asked for non smoking. The bathroom was rife! Toilet was crawling and smelt of a men's urinal. The shower could not be regulated so it either scolded or was freezing! Broken door handles.... and the windows would not stay open without jamming a wedge between them: seeing is believing. The beds smelt unclean, blood stains on the walls and curtains, the wardrobe was broken, full of mosquitos and to top all that there was a leaking ceiling!! The staff lacked customer care and we couldn't wait to leave. Please DO NOT stay here, pay that little bit extra and have hygiene. Amsterdam is a wonderful city, you will love it, just don't spoil your stay by using this disgusting pit of a place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor accomodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: UpNorthUSA
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Hotel YBoulevard from the ad on the internet. The location was pretty good as we wanted something fairly close to the train station . It was totally not what we had expected from the description in the ad,- which made it sound great,- and a good value for the money. Not so. The room was very dirty, the bedding had assorted "stains", the bathroom was filthy, and the breakfast was only so-so. The walls were paper thin and noisey with people coming and going.. For starters, we had to ask the desk person to come and vacume our room, and bring us cleaner bedding. The hotel itself was very old and it appears, has never been updated or redecorated. The carpeting was worn out, raggy, and badly stained. No window shades. There were no amenities in the bathroom, and there was black hair all over the floor ( Not cleaned ) and mold on the tile/ grout throughout it. They have rooms in a basement area that looked to be worse than ours was. I left a letter for the manager and was assured he would contact me. I also contacted the booking agent who forwarded my letter on to them for a second try, and again was assured they would contact me. This has not happened. For the amount of money it cost, I could and would have spent a bit more and stayed in a place that was worth it. This hotel is Not Recommended. May 2007 - Woody and Sue - St. Paul, Minnesota USA

Reviews.Title: “Faulty towers”
Reviews.Author: munkaM/cr
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune to stay in. It was dirty nothing worked i.e. WC's shower the staff weren't overly helpful although one or two tried their best. We had a quad room with only one door key which made coming and going difficult, one lad had to climb in through the window! Despite me asking several times if they could fix are broken shower nothing was ever done about it, Several of our group were in the basement which was cold and flooded during the rain. The hotel isnâ€™t cheap and what you get for your money is very poor quality, Iâ€™d never stay here again hopefully someone night read this review before booking and not bother! The official website has some very clearly taken photos to make the place look mint but I can tell you itâ€™s not itâ€™s run down dirty and in need of a total refurbishment. We travelled home on a ferry and the tiny cabin was like a five star penthouse suite compared the room we got! Oh well at least Amsterdam is a belting city so you wont have to spend much time in this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: JoepublicLondon
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location good, near centre and train station. Breakfast reasonable. Bad points: Our room had a dirty dusty carpet, smelt strongly of stale cigarettes, curtain only covered 60% of window, mirror was on floor, toilet did not work, toilet door handle broken, only one light bulb out of three worked. No ladder for bunk bed. Fire doors did not close. Cleaners left our door open. We would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: charn
Reviews.Content: As already posted the hotel is ok for budget accomodation but make sure the bed bugs have gone! I am still in a lot of discomfort 2 weeks later!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: sam.mason
Reviews.Content: good location, ok breakfast, rooms of a hostel standard and after returning home the 13 of us who stayed there found ourselfes covered in BED BUGS BITES - which are still on us and very unattractively red and very itchy - be careful cheak under the mattrase before you sleep here!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: stuwilky
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel prior to reading these reviews we were a little concerned. Upon arrival the manager (apparently) apologised for our room as it was the worst in the hotel, and promised to move us the following day if we asked. This further scared us! However the room was fine, the bed was comfortable, everything was clean and worked so we were quite happy to use it as a base. When we returned after an afternoon in the cafe's of Amsterdam we found that all our stuff had been moved to the best room in the hotel (according to the staff!)
