Which we hadnt asked for, but was a nice surprise. Some of the staff are a little surly and rude, but the bottom line is that the hotel was fine as a base to explore the wonders of Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “alright”
Reviews.Author: den_ireland
Reviews.Content: What you see is what you get, we had 30 lads on a trip. It provided a bed and thats about it, showers are [----], flood everywhere. Not the cleanest in the world You can do much better than this place but its fine for stags etc

Reviews.Title: “simple but clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicetime
Reviews.Content: After reading the other comments I was really thinking if I should stay in this hotel, but Amsterdam was full most places have been fully booked. This is a very simple hotel my room was small but clean. The restaurant looked new and nice. This hotel does need more care, but what do you expect from a simple hotel? The stuff was friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “What a shocker!!”
Reviews.Author: London32
Reviews.Content: This has to be the absolute worst hotel I have stayed in (and I have travelled extensively). It was filthy dirty, the staff were unorganised, the room was horrible, the carpets were filthy and damp, the room very very small, and faced onto a very busy street. The windows didnt open more than 6 inches, the room was very stuffy and unpleasant. The bathroom was a horror storey, its stank of human waste, the shower flooded (even though the water dribbled out). The bed linen was dirty and the bed barely held together for the duration of our stay. The location is ok, but atleast 10 mins to the square. It was completely overpriced. I would not recommend this place to anyone, avoid it like the plague! HORROR!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from Amsterdam after staying at Hotel Y Boulevard. After booking we checked this site to find horrible reviews. Needless to say we considered cancelling the rooms. Limited choice made us stick with the hotel and I am glad we did. There was a group of 6 of us and none of us have any complaints about the hotel. The rooms were clean, dry and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was perfect for the whole city. We had a brilliant time and I will definiately recommend this hotel to other people in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews was expecting the worst, but was pleasantly surprise, our room looked out over the harbour and was clean and warm. The staff where great, and the breakfast plentiful. Good location,could have done with tea and coffee making facilities.But I,ve paid a lot more to stay in worse places,

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paoloc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during congress week for a weekend in september 2005 the place is an absolute dive we were given a basement room which was absolutely humming of damp so bad that we kept extractor fan in the bathroom on whilst we were out but to no avail!!! the carpet in the room was so dirty you actually stuck to it!!! I have travelled round India twice and i can honestly say this is the worst hotel/guest house that ive ever Stayed in. Dont touch it with a bargepole!!!!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: truthordare
Reviews.Content: hello!!!! just got back yesterday from this hotel, stayed there with my gfriend last wed - sat and having read the reviews on here which i feel are harsh! so thought id add what i thought!!! basically the location was good - opposite the floating chinese restaurant (the food there is great), and the nemo museum (which again is wicked fun), and a short walking distant from everything. Ive given it 4 stars based on the fact that our room was clean, not small, we had hot water all the time, it didnt smell, the sheets were clean, we had fresh towels everyday, and cable tv with 30 channels.....although we dont speak dutch but we had bbc1 and 2!!so i got to c motd!we were on the top floor and it was 3 flights of steep stairs but all buildings in amsterdam are like this!!!! the bed was very comfy and next door unintentionally entertained us on the first might as the walls were thin....er... the breakfast was ok - juice / tea and coffee and toast, croissants, cereal , meat,cheese etc so not bad!who doesnt like toast!! the food we had (pizza) from the restaurant was freshly made/cooked and delicious!and the bar was reasonable. so in conclusion good value. amsterdam isnt cheap but the staff were very friendly and helpful! the place is nicely decorated and we had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January 2005. The place was being redecorated while we were there but just the main reception area and outside, there were no paint fumes in our room. It's a very keenly priced hotel and the room was not fantastic but it was kept clean and tidy. If you're just after somewhere to sleep (like we were) then I'd recommend it as it's in a very good location a few minutes walk from the train station and the centre of Amsterdam and you can't argue with the price. If you're after luxury then give it a miss but if you're travelling on a budget and want to be near the centre then it's great. The staff were always very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “just coming back from The hague”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights. Rooms are basic but clean. Dont expect a sea view as some of the rooms are in a downstaris floor. Breakfast, even a bit plain is cool to have in the main lounge next to the sea. OVerall is ok. Right location next to the tram and right to the beach

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump, we booked a room online and travelled in October 2003. Tried 2 rooms, 1 in the basement and 1 on the first floor. Bed sheets dirty, light switches falling off, bathroom smelling, carpet sticky, absolutely filthy. We done budget travel before but this place was completely unacceptable. We refused to stay and got our money back, went to a hotel booking agency down the road and got a room at the Amsterdam Hilton for the same price as this dump was charging us. A good tip if you are on a short stay and it is the weekend, the chains such as hilton are empty and are giving the rooms away, just go to one of the hotel booking agencies and they will have deals that compare with the budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking to stay in the lap of luxuary then there is no point in even looking at this hotel but if your not really too fussed about how you stay then this is the perfect place to stay. The hotel is clean the staff are helpful and the room i stayed in was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On first impression the front looked scruffy, the hall way was dark and damp, reception and bar looked clean but empty.The room on second floor looked out onto scaffolding and empty houses, the room smelt of damp, mold all over walls of room and in bathroom, light swithces fall off in hand and carpets patched and curtains hanging off rails, an unwelcome feel to the whole hotel.We refused to stay the night we felt it would be better for our health to loose the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view from the upper rooms..”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Cheap, not far from the city centre and not that bad at all. I'm more used to more expensive hotels but this one was quite all right. The staff was unfriendly that's true, but there room was clean, the breakfast was all right and from te top floor we had a nice view from the Nemo building to the Centraal station. Good for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Y Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: Caz82Scotland
Reviews.Content: More hostel than hotel, the staff were unhelpful and sometimes unfriendly. Outside, the hotel looks nice, and the reception area is attractive, but this was undermined by the empty bar, and unappealing breakfasts of ham and cheese. The rooms were mainly small and stuffy (some looked more like closets), and there were only hand towels in the en-suite shower-room. The owners didn't keep essential items on hand such as toilet rolls and spare light bulbs.

Reviews.Title: “Y Boulevard”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever set foot in. It was that bad I didn't even ask to see the room. Set in a dingy, dirty area of Amsterdam within a short distance of Central Station, you would not send your dog to it for a break.The hotel front is completely unwelcoming, the entrance hall is dark and dirty, reminiscent of a smoky coffee shop, nothing appealing whatsoever.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Y Boulevard
HotelInfo.Address: Prins Hendrikkade 144-145, Amsterdam 1011 AT, The Netherlands
